title.justification: The paper is clearly identified by this title on the first page.

extractions.description: This paper introduces a conditional generative probabilistic model for set-valued data with a tractable log density, using continuous normalizing flows governed by permutation equivariant dynamics. The model is applied to complex traffic scene generation and object bounding box generation, demonstrating significant performance improvements over non-permutation invariant baselines.

type.justification: The paper presents a new model and applies it to specific tasks, reporting performance metrics, comparisons with baselines, and specific quantitative results.
type.quote: We illustrate the utility of this model via applications including (1) complex traffic scene generation conditioned on visually specified map information, and (2) object bounding box generation conditioned directly on images.

name.justification: The paper focuses on creating a generative probabilistic model for set-valued data.
name.quote: We present a conditional generative probabilistic model of set-valued data with a tractable log density.

name.justification: The paper uses continuous normalizing flows as a primary technique for the generative model.
name.quote: This model is a continuous normalizing flow governed by permutation equivariant dynamics.

name.justification: One of the applications of the model is generating traffic scenes.
name.quote: We illustrate the utility of this model via applications including (1) complex traffic scene generation conditioned on visually specified map information, and (2) object bounding box generation conditioned directly on images.

name.justification: One of the applications discussed is generating object bounding boxes.
name.quote: We illustrate the utility of this model via applications including (1) complex traffic scene generation conditioned on visually specified map information, and (2) object bounding box generation conditioned directly on images.

name.justification: The paper introduces this model explicitly and uses it throughout the experiments.

is_contributed.justification: The model is introduced by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: We present a conditional generative probabilistic model of set-valued data with a tractable log density.

is_executed.justification: The model is implemented and tested across different experiments, with performance metrics reported.
is_executed.quote: We demonstrate our conditional permutation invariant flow on two difficult conditional density estimation tasks: realistic traffic scene generation (Fig. 1) given a map and bounding box prediction given an image.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the introduced model against several baselines, including non-permutation invariant flows.
is_compared.quote: To test the performance of our flows on this task, we train them to generate a scene of cars in the INTERACTION dataset ... We compare our conditional flows against several baselines.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The model is novel, without a reference paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We present a conditional generative probabilistic model of set-valued data with a tractable log density.

name.justification: The INTERACTION dataset is explicitly mentioned as the source of data for traffic scene generation.
name.quote: To test the performance of our flows on this task, we train them to generate a scene of cars in the INTERACTION dataset (Zhan et al., 2019)...

referenced_paper_title.value: INTERACTION Dataset: An INTERnational, Adversarial and Cooperative moTION Dataset in Interactive Driving Scenarios with Semantic Maps
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title of the INTERACTION dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To test the performance of our flows on this task, we train them to generate a scene of cars in the INTERACTION dataset (Zhan et al., 2019)...

name.justification: The CLEVR dataset is used for the bounding box prediction experiments.
name.quote: We assess the viability of our approach through the CLEVR (Johnson et al., 2017) dataset, which is a standard benchmark for set-generation models...

referenced_paper_title.value: CLEVR: A Diagnostic Dataset for Compositional Language and Elementary Visual Reasoning
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title of the CLEVR dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We assess the viability of our approach through the CLEVR (Johnson et al., 2017) dataset, which is a standard benchmark for set-generation models...

name.justification: The paper mentions using the torchdiffeq library for solving differential equations.
name.quote: This functionality is all available in the torchdiffeq package (Chen et al., 2018)

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference paper for the torchdiffeq library.
referenced_paper_title.quote: This functionality is all available in the torchdiffeq package (Chen et al., 2018)
